clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA who have moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: DAS 44 (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.2)

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes: MTX+SSZ+HCQ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA who have moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Remission (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: DAS 44 < 1.6)

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values of no effect and benefit. Small sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes: MTX+SSZ+HCQ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA who have moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Disability (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22)

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Small sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes: MTX+SSZ+HCQ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA who have moderate to high disease activity

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes: MTX+SSZ+HCQ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA who have moderate to high disease activity
outcome: Withdrawal due to adverse events (follow up: 3 months)

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes: MTX+SSZ+HCQ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
